metadata.title: Erowid Morphine Vault : Timeline
metadata.description: A timeline of events in the history of morphine

content:
Drug: Morphine | cid: 5288826
Source: erowid | Source description: A timeline of events in the history of morphine
Erowid name: morphine
Category: PHARMS
Field: History

                    Text: 
                    Donate now and receive yours!

Morphine

Timeline

by Erowid

1806 Morphine is first isolated. Early 1850s First experimentation with injecting medications. 1853 Hypodermic needle-syringes with a point fine enough to pierce the skin are invented simultaneously by Charles Gabriel Pravaz (French surgeon) and Alexander Wood (Scottish physician).  It is first used to inject morphine intravenously. 1861 Commercially manufactured hypodermic syringes are available in Europe and America.  (A Brief History of Cocaine) 1906 Pure Food and Drug Act is passed, regulating the labelling of products containing Alcohol, Opiates, Cocaine, and Cannabis, among others.  The law went into effect Jan 1, 1907 1 [Details] The act required correct labelling of products containing "alcohol, morphine, opium, cocaine, heroin, alpha or beta eucaine, chloroform, cannabis indica, chloral hydrate, or acetanilide, or any derivative or preparation of any such substances contained therein."

References


                    Context: 
                    This section provides a historical overview of morphine, including its first isolation in 1806, development of hypodermic syringe technology in the 1850s, and key regulatory changes such as the 1906 Pure Food and Drug Act. It is part of the Erowid Pharms collection, offering detailed timelines on drug development, regulation, and usage. This content is relevant for understanding the historical and legal context of morphine within the broader database of substances and drug history.
